item.description:
If you're wondering what the title of January's meetup means, it's simply the titles of our next two books joined together. Viktor Frankl's Man's Search for Meaning is the search for meaning when we experience pain and suffering. It's been a staple for many college psychology courses and has inspired its readers for years.

Bill Bryson's Neither Here nor There is one of his fun memoirs. This one tracks his time backpacking across Europe with his unforgettable sidekick Stephen Katz.

Both books are fairly short so we should be able to get both done for January 19th.

Our venue will be Unwined in Manchester, a great wine bar with an atmosphere that's good for discussions.

Normal 12 person cap applies so RSVP as soon as you can. And if your plans change, please change your RSVP as soon as you can.

group.name: The Southern NH Books and Brew Club

item.name: Man's Search for Meaning is Neither Here Nor There
